headline: Dayforce Q2 Earnings Beat Estimates, Revenues Up Y/Y, Shares Down
summary: DAY posts 27% EPS growth and offers positive 2025 guidance, fueled by strong recurring revenues and margin expansion.

headline: Dayforce (DAY) Q2 Earnings and Revenues Beat Estimates
summary: Dayforce (DAY) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +17.31% and +1.41%, respectively, for the quarter ended June 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Dayforce beats quarterly revenue estimates on steady software demand
summary: Demand for the company's software services has been stable as more enterprises increased their use of artificial intelligence and cloud-based platforms to run day-to-day operations.  However, some analysts have warned that moderating employment trends and rising concerns about a deteriorating labor market could hit the HCM industry, as companies pull back spending due to the aggressive U.S. tariffs.  Dayforce's shares have fallen more than 26% this year, underperforming larger peers such as Paycom and Automatic Data Processing.

headline: Dayforce’s (NYSE:DAY) Q2 Sales Beat Estimates But Full-Year Sales Guidance Misses Expectations Significantly
summary: Online payroll and human resource software provider Dayforce (NYSE:DAY) reported Q2 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 9.8% year on year to $464.7 million. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $439 million was less impressive, coming in 9.2% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.61 per share was 16.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Dayforce: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: MINNEAPOLIS (AP) — Dayforce Inc DAY on Wednesday reported second-quarter net income of $21.3 million. On a per-share basis, the Minneapolis-based company said it had net income of 13 cents. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, were 61 cents per share.
